document.docAuthor: Rheims, Cristina A. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.docTitle: Scytodes tabuleiro Rheims & Brescovit, 2009, new species
document.masterDocTitle: New additions to the Brazilian fauna of the genus Scytodes Latreille (Araneae: Scytodidae) with emphasis on the Atlantic Forest species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New additions to the Brazilian fauna of the genus Scytodes Latreille (Araneae: Scytodidae) with emphasis on the Atlantic Forest species

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 130 – 140. 130 – 135. Scytodes tabuleiro n. sp. 130. Male habitus, dorsal. 131 – 133. Left male palp (131 prolateral, 132 retrolateral, 133 detail of distal region, dorsal). 134 – 135. Female epigynum (134 ventral, 135 dorsal). 136 – 140. Scytodes maquine n. sp. 136. Male habitus, dorsal. 137 – 138. Left male palp (137 prolateral, 138 retrolateral). 139 – 140. Female epigynum (139 ventral, 140 dorsal) (SP = sclerotized process). Scale lines: 0.5 mm.

Etymology . The specific name is a noun in apposition that refers to the type locality of the holotype .

Diagnosis . Males of
Scytodes tabuleiro
n.sp. resemble those of
S. marlieria
n.sp. by the dorso-ventrally narrow distal region of the palp (
Figs. 49–51
,
131– 133
). They are distinguished by the sclerotized process, almost as long as the distal region in
S. tabuleiro
n.sp. (
Figs. 131–133
). The females are distinguished from those of the other Neotropical
Scytodes
by the peculiar shape of the hyaline pockets in the epigynum, with the anterior region bent outwards over the large sclerotized lateral area (
Fig. 135
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 130–140. 130–135.
Scytodes tabuleiro
n.sp. 130. Male habitus, dorsal. 131–133. Left male palp (131 prolateral, 132 retrolateral, 133 detail of distal region, dorsal). 134–135. Female epigynum (134 ventral, 135 dorsal). 136–140.
Scytodes maquine
n.sp. 136. Male habitus, dorsal. 137–138. Left male palp (137 prolateral, 138 retrolateral). 139–140. Female epigynum (139 ventral, 140 dorsal) (SP = sclerotized process). Scale lines: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation . Ten males: total length 3.1–3.8 ; carapace 1.7 –2.0; femur I 3.7–4.6 ; bulb 0.50–0.70 . Ten females: total length 3.8–5.5 ; carapace 1.8–2.6 ; femur I 2.1–3.1 .
Distribution . Atlantic Forest. States of Paraná, Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul.
